Not much effect, but it looks like we're making some progress!
We've got a lot more Dropships approaching!
We're going to need a transport to get the Rhino to that position.
Hmmm. My calculations show that two more Rhinos will be necessary to open a hole big enough. The final two positions have been marked.
I've marked the forth and fifth postions.
The Covenant must have figured out what we are doing. We're going to need a larger force to take those locations!
Cross your fingers! Firing all Rhinos in 3...2...1!
All right! The dome generators and air defenses are the main targets. Light 'em up!
Rhino was lost - get one back in position.
Spirit of Fire, this is Red Team. We are 100 meters from Ander's transponder signal...meeting strong resistance. Seeing some pretty crazy stuff out here. Over.
Hold your position Red Team. Reinforcements will come to you.
Take out more colonies quickly - the first one is starting to regenerate!
Spirit of Fire, getting a little hairy here, sir. Where's that backup?
I've received Red Team's coordinates. I've marked it on your map.
Not sure what just happened, but the large one just shook like it was hurt.
We are almost close enough to place the explosive!
One of the colonies has regenerated and the large creature has gained strength.
All right! All the creatures are dying!
They've destroyed another airlock. Don't let the enemy take them all out!
Optional: Keep at Least One Deck Gun Alive
Captain, if we shoot down the transport ships before they drop off their troops it will slow them down.
Cyclops can be tasked onto the power core to repair it. The more on the job, the faster the repair.
The power core is nearly destroyed!
They've taken a bite out of our repair efforts. Fight them off!
Our power core has been repaired about halfway.
Captain, we need damage control or the Spirit of Fire is going down.
Optional: Prevent Any Airlock from Being Destroyed
Captain, they're transporting invasion forces onto the hull.
The Spirit's power core is almost repaired.
They're attacking with both aircraft and ground troops. We should upgrade our turrets to counter appropriately.
The power core is destroyed; we've lost the ship. Serina, begin emergency evacuation sequence.
The power core is fully repaired. Serina, best speed away.
Forge, use Cyclopses to repair the power core while you defend against Covenant attacks!

It can't fire in two directions at once; maybe we can use that to our advantage.
The Scarab is about half dead, or half alive. Take your pick.
The temple ruins in this area will provide some cover, but not forever.
The Scarab's searchlight beam shows the direction it's facing.
Build up a base and army, and go kill that Scarab.
The Scarab's head is moving even slower now - keep it up.
The head is tracking more slowly.
Your Command Center has been destroyed. You have failed.
The Scarab is destroyed. Victory is ours today.
You've advanced to where the forcefield stood. Take a look around.
If that thing burns through that barrier of ruins and destroys our Command Center, we're dead.
You've destroyed a power node. The Scarab's head is turning a little more slowly.
Destroy those Locusts wherever you find them - they're building-killers.
The Scarab is incomplete but its head is operational. Its field of fire prevents any chance of retreat or extraction - you'll have to destroy it.
The Scarab's weapon system is relying on the power nodes in this area. Destroy them to reduce the Scarab's combat effectiveness.
Activate the second door across from this one.
One set of doors is open. Open the remaining two pairs of doors.
One pair of doors remain. Open them to free Spirit of Fire.
If we don't get that door open before the sun goes critical we're dead.
Use the nodes at the edge of the door to reactivate them.
There must be some pattern to opening the doors.
The Forerunner lettering seems to be paired across two door sections. Maybe that's the key...
One set down, two more to go.
It seems you can activate only one pair of doors at a time
The Sentinels are attracted to the activated nodes. You're going to have to work quickly
It seems the Sentinels are more worried about the Flood than us. Get them to fight each other and we may buy ourselves some time.
The planet is tearing itself apart - keep an eye out for debris.
Good work! We may survive this after all...
The Sentinel A.I. is shutting the doors; it has enacted a planetwide alarm of some kind. The whole planet is locking down!
The Sentinels seem to be combining into larger forms. If this continues they may become unstoppable.
Flood infections detected near you area.
Debris is falling your way - look out!
What are they doing? They're combining!
Get that door open - we only have one shot at this!
We won't be able to send any supplies this time. Requisition as much of an army as you can muster and get the door open.
You don't have much time left - get those last doors open!
Ah perfect - there's a stinkin' Covenant Outpost right where you marked. We better take that out first.
Forge, get out there and get those things off my ship!
Sentinel drones, attacking from the front!
Serina, report. What's going on here?
You can requisition troops from the airlocks on the deck. If we lose those airlocks we'll be defenseless.
The drones are leaving. Serina, what's going on here?
Take that thing out. We've got to get the ship out of here
If we lose all the airlocks, we'll lose the ship.
Best guess? We're being pulled through some sort of docking system.
That alien life form has followed us in. We have a significant infestation on the aft quarter.
Those aliens are dropping pods on the hull from all around us - keep watch for them.
Alien population on the hull is increasing and the structure is reacting...more of those drones inbound too.
I'm detecting some sort of alarm from the planet's A.I. Something's coming.
Flood levels are rising. I'm also picking up high energy readings...coming from the tunnel.
Sergeant Forge, get your men into the airlocks. Something very bad is coming.
A large enemy object is approaching. Scans indicate a drone variant. It's blocking the exit.
The ring is coming again! Take cover!
No problem. I told you we'd make it.
Security barrier breached. High-order infection detected. Unidentified alien intrusion detected. Initiating Stage 3 defense protocols.
High order infection approaching sector zero. Inner biosphere threat. Possible Reclaimer signature, undetermined. Deploying Stage 3 Enforcer.

The UNSC Cyclops is a unique, special infantry unit. Experimental exo-skeleton suits provide incredible strength, making the Cyclops ideal for destroying buildings or other large things.
High ranking Brute infantry that wields a powerful Gravity Hammer. Their ability to pull units towards them and stun them makes Chieftains especially effective against heavy ground vehicles.

Now, we'll learn how to select and command your units.
Use the LEFT STICK $$LS$$ to center the CROSSHAIR over the Warthog next to your base.
When the CROSSHAIR is over a unit, you can select it. Press $$A$$ to select the Warthog.
When units are selected, you can give them orders. Units will always try to follow your commands.
Use the LEFT STICK $$LS$$ to move the CROSSHAIR over the beacon. Press $$X$$ to tell your Warthog to move there.

There's another Crate nearby. Use $$X$$ to gather those Supplies with your Warthog.

Cargo TWO. We aren't going to last much longer!
Cargo ONE. We got buckled plates. Any more shots and we're through!

This is Forge. We've been ambushed at the relic site. I'm pinned down with Anders. We've taken heavy losses - we need reinforcements now!
Sergeant, Alpha Base won't be able to respond in time. We've got Grizzlies inbound from Spirit of Fire. Hold on down there...
Ah, Grizzly tanks - Forge's pet project.
Good work! Professor, I want to be briefed on your findings as soon as you're onboard.
We've got to get that data. Let's try that again.
About time. I was down to my last clip.
Grizzlies. Well, at least I know how to repair them.
Cover me - I'm pulling back with Anders.
They've blown the controls. We're cut off!
The control panel is damaged - I can't reactivate this bridge.
Get me to the east bridge's control panel. I think I can get it activated.
Watch that six, we're moving out!
Give me a minute and I'll get this bridge operational.
Got it, the bridge is operational.
You heard the lady; let's give her some privacy.
Secure the Area by Killing all Covenant in the Crater
Well this little field trip is a bust. Anders, is there anything out here except for that huge alien dome thing?
Platoon recovered, enroute to the Spirit.
Spirit, evac forces requesting a repair on the base.
I think I can reactivate those bridge controls.
Watch those doors - looks like company is coming!
Omega Team, secure the sector, clear out that Covenant base!
The Covenant are building structures to the north of our base!
Scans indicate the Covenant are building a large plasma weapon.
Move the CROSSHAIR toward your base.
Good. A base is a collection of buildings. It starts with the Command Center...
To construct your first building, press $$A$$ at the building site indicated.
Selecting any building site brings up the BUILDING MENU. Use the LEFT STICK $$LS$$ to highlight the Supply Pad.
That's it! Press $$A$$ while the Supply Pad is highlighted to begin construction.
Good. Unlike Crates, Supply Pads provide a steady stream of resources.
It takes quite a few Supplies to make an army, so it's usually good to have more than one Supply Pad. Build another one over here.
Now let's train some Marines. Marines come from a Barracks. Build a Barracks over here.
Select the Barracks and train a squad of Marines.
Use the LEFT STICK $$LS$$ to highlight the Marines and then press $$A$$ to start the training.
Your first squad of Marines has finished training! Press $$B$$ to close the BUILDING MENU.
Move your CROSSHAIR to the Marines.
All of the units you train from this base will gather here.
Select the Barracks and train four more Marine squads.
You can queue up more than one Marine at a time by pressing $$A$$ multiple times.
Now that we have enough squads, let's get ready for the next phase.
Directing allied forces to your location
No allied forces available for attack
Allies will rally at your base
Allied forces retreating to rally point
We don't have intel at that location. Sending allied scout
Directing allied scout to attack zone
Directing a small allied strike force to take out the target
Yes sir! All allied forces ordered to attack
All allied forces being sent to defend
Dispatching allied scout. Note, your allies are low on forces
Request resources from ally? (click again for yes)
Your ally is low on supplies
We should hold out for a stronger attack.
We don't stand a chance. Requesting you delay that order.
Dispatching reinforcements to turn the tide of this battle.
All right, now we'll learn how to select groups of units. Move the CROSSHAIR to the Marines.
Good. Now, select that first Marine squad, but this time, press and hold $$A$$.
Notice the expanding selection circle. The circle will select every unit it touches.
Select all of your Marines by holding $$A$$ and moving the circle with the LEFT STICK $$LS$$.
Well, those are the basics. Feel free to keep playing against the A.I. opponent. We'll give you a few more pointers as you explore.
Take a look around your base. We've opened up more units and buildings for you to make.
There is a red enemy base on the far side of the map. Destroy it to win.
This is an unclaimed base location. When your units are close to it, you can select it with $$A$$ and construct a new base.
This base has been claimed by your enemy. If you destroy it, however, you'll be able to build your own base here.
Reactors are critical buildings. As you build more Reactors, new units and technologies are unlocked. Red numbers indicate that you don't have enough Reactors.
Technology upgrades improve your units by making them stronger and giving them new combat abilities.
You should get some armor on the battlefield. Build a Vehicle Depot and train a Scorpion Tank.
You might want some aircraft. Construct an Air Pad and train a few Hornets.
Your Marines need some upgrades. Research the New Blood Upgrade at the Barracks to add another Marine to each squad.
If you kill the Jackals, you can gather the Supply Crates here uncontested. At least until your opponent shows up...
Evac Pelican inbound with UNSC survivors - cover us.
Kill these Grunts to make this area safer for your own units.
This Forerunner artifact generates Supply Crates. There's another on the other side of the map, too.
You might want to see if your opponent has found it yet.
Marines and Flamethrowers can use this sniper tower for range and defense.
Some units, such as Marines and Warthogs, have special combat abilities. With one of these units selected, press $$Y$$ on an enemy to see the unique ability.
Marines can throw grenades using $$Y$$. With only Marines selected, press $$Y$$ on an enemy to see the carnage!
Warthogs can ram enemies using their special ability. With only Warthogs selected, press $$Y$$ on an enemy to run him over!
Okay, the gloves are off. The A.I. player is now active.
Oh boy, are you in for it...
You're getting buzzed by some enemy Warthogs! Fortunately, your units will automatically attack enemies.
You may also command your units to attack specific enemies by pressing $$X$$ when the CROSSHAIR turns red.
There are some enemy Marines over there. Follow the OBJECTIVE ARROW and send your Marines in to attack!
The Hornet is your primary aircraft. It is quick and good against many things.
The Vulture is awesome. It flies, does a ton of damage and has the Barrage ability. With only Vultures selected, press $$Y$$ on an enemy to ruin their day.
Flame Marines are fast and short ranged and will incinerate any infantry they attack.
The ODST is a Fleet upgrade to the Marines. They work just like Marines - only better.
Cobras are an anti-vehicle unit. With only Cobras selected, press $$Y$$ to lockdown the Cobra for extra damage and extra range.
The Elephant is a mobile Barracks. With only an Elephant selected, press $$Y$$ to deploy it. Once deployed it behaves like a Barracks.
The Wolverine's primary role is annihilating enemy aircraft.
Turrets can defend your base against early attacks.
All UNSC ground forces are supported by the Spirit of Fire orbiting above. To see the powers Spirit of Fire gives you press UP on the D-PAD $$DPAD$$.
These are Spirit of Fire's powers. Some cost Supplies and Reactors, some are free. Some do damage to enemies, some heal your units.
There is a limit to the number of units that you can have. The topmost number in the display near the minimap shows how close you are to that limit.
This is your opponent's main base.
You win! Thanks for playing the Halo Wars Alpha Tutorial! Go get into some games!
To select all units on screen at once, press $$RB$$.
To select all units everywhere, press $$LB$$.
Press $$X$$ to move your units to CROSSHAIR
Press $$RB$$ to select all units on screen
Move crosshair to where you want to go
This is Omega Team. This sector is clear. We're gone!
Other UNSC units have been notified and are retreating to your position.
Thanks for the cover - we're ready to help!
Patrol again. We're losing people here! It's a massacre! We need the military!
Those civilians have no cover - they're dead without military support!
This crashed pelican looks like good cover.
Press $$A$$ to Start or $$B$$ to CANCEL
We need to establish a larger military presence on the ground.
Attach this to a single squad to have the Protector heal the protected squad out of combat.
Attach this to a single squad to have the Protector attack targets that are shooting the protected squad.
Captain Cutter can request to have an upgraded Station dropped in from orbit. Eventually, it can be upgraded to a Fortress.
New units from this base will move to this location when training is complete. Use the Global Rally Point to override this behavior.

The area is dominated by large mountains and chasms, but there are still many possible approaches to traverse the rugged landscape. Scattered Sniper Towers are positioned perfectly to defend key tactical locations.
With many supplies up for grabs in the middle and dangerous enemies lurking everywhere, the fight for control of this region will be nasty, brutal, and short.
A wide open map, this cold wasteland features two bonus Reactors and a Forerunner Spire of Healing.
This factory can be used to produce Forerunner Sentinels. Different types of Sentinels can be created, each with different uses.
This Forerunner Protector Plant makes Protectors that can be attached to your squads to add new abilities. There are many different types of Protectors.
Covenant are all over us. No way to save everyone.
Loss in 1 minute unless a base is claimed.
Timer paused while base under construction.
Yes - when the colony was destroyed, I registered the large creature weakening.
This is a really long string that I want to have $$A$$ some buttons embedded in it. I don't know how it's going $$B$$ to look but we will see. This is the latest sentence in this long string.
Provides Reactor when Garrisoned with Infantry
Allows more Troops to be Deployed.
Are you sure you want to kick this player?
Are you sure you want to quit? Any unsaved progress will be lost.
Are you sure you want to restart? Any unsaved progress will be lost.
Are you sure you want to resign? Any unsaved progress will be lost.
Are you sure you want to destroy this base to free up the site for an ally?
Are you sure you want to recycle this building in order to build another?
Almost there! The Scarab is nearly destroyed.
They've launched a counterattack on our base.
To select all of one type of unit, press $$A$$ twice while the CROSSHAIR is over that unit.
The game has gone out of sync with the other players.
An Xbox Live Gold membership or permission for online gameplay is required.
The Halo Wars Alpha Tutorial Map
Press $$LB$$ to select all the units on the map. Press $$RB$$ to select all the units on the screen.
Press LEFT on the D-PAD to cycle between your bases.
Press DOWN on the D-PAD to cycle between your armies.
Press UP on the D-PAD to jump to SPIRIT OF FIRE. Many cool powers and abilities are initiated from the orbiting ship.
Press RIGHT on the D-PAD to cycle through the last few notifications you've received, such as UNDER ATTACK or BUILDING COMPLETE.
Press $$X$$ to do a MOVE or PRIMARY ATTACK. Press $$Y$$ to do the SECONDARY ATTACK or ABILITY.
Holding $$A$$ down will initiate a paint selection mode. This is useful for easily selecting some of the units on your screen.
Double tapping $$A$$ on top of a unit will instantly select all the units of that type on the screen.
Use the RIGHT TRIGGER to quickly cycle between the automatic sub groups. This is useful for giving fast commands to parts of your army.
Hold the LEFT TRIGGER to drastically increase the speed of your camera.
Captain Cutter has a unique unit called the ELEPHANT. It's a mobile barracks. Deploy it using $$Y$$. Once deployed, you can train infantry units from it.
The evil Prophet brings the awesome CLEANSING power to the battlefield. Normally utilized to glass planets into oblivion, this beam devastates your army. Kill the Prophet to stop the beam.
Want some uber destruction? Pull up the SPIRIT OF FIRE by pressing UP on $$DPAD$$ and unleash the MAC BLAST power.
Why limit yourself to just one Spartan? Build up to three and unleash their combined combat power. Or, use them to Jack enemy vehicles.
DEPRECATED To play Halo Wars, you need to be signed into an Xbox Live Gold gamer profile. Press $$A$$ to sign into Xbox Live now.
DEPRECATED To play Halo Wars, you need to be signed into an Xbox Live Gold gamer profile. Press $$A$$ to sign into Xbox Live with a Gold gamer profile.
Halo Wars could not authorize the active Xbox Live profile.
Scorpion, nice! Scorpions are your main vehicle; they pack a good punch against everything.
You can use the DPAD to jump to various vantage points. You can cycle through your bases and armies or even contact Spirit of Fire in orbit.
The MINIMAP in the top corner of the screen shows an overhead view of the map. You are blue. Your enemies are red.
Units gain combat experience as they fight. Veteran units are tougher and do more damage. The pips above a unit tell you how experienced it is.
DEPRECATED Halo Wars could not authorize the active Xbox Live profile.
Ready and waiting for game to start...
Press $$Y$$ to invite friends to play
Destroy the Dome Generators and Air Defenses
There are not enough players connected to the game for it to continue.
The M12 Warthog is powered by a 12-liter hydrogen engine.
Hunters! There's too many! We need to make a run for the exit!
Sergeant Forge, we've got your back! Get Anders out of here!
Directing additional attack forces to this area
Allied air strike on the way
Directing heavy armor to this area
Directing light forces to this area
Temples allow the Covenant to access advanced buildings, units and technology upgrades.
Suicide Grunts are a perverted variant of the already dangerous Grunts. They can sacrifice themselves on enemy targets using the Suicide Ability.
Suicide Grunts are a perverted variant of the already dangerous Grunts. They can sacrifice themselves on enemy targets using the Suicide Ability.
A support unit that repairs and heals nearby allied units. They will explode when killed, dealing damage to nearby enemy units.
Suicide Grunts are faster in Suicide Mode.
The Suicide Grunt's explosion splashes enemies with burning chemicals.

The Blessed Warehouse produces extra resources (compared to the default Warehouse) needed to train units, build buildings, and buy technology upgrades. Bases that have great resource production might have 7 Warehouses.
Optional: Destroy the Covenant Methane Refinery
Harvest Surface Command, Pillar of Autumn - Request for Plasma Rhino is approved. Rhino is inbound.
Request for Plasma Rhino received, it's en route.
Roger that, Plasma Rhino delivery is in the air.
Rhino LRA Plasma augment on its way.
We'll have that Rhino on the ground in no time.
Order acknowledged, Rhino is en route.
Special Spartan Omega Team is Great!
Our primary mission here is to reach that structure. Destroying that base is a secondary objective.
If we blow up these refineries the enemy airpads will go with them. Nice.
I've lost contact with some Warthogs on patrol. Keep an eye out for them will you?
I made a few improvements. My own special upgrades...
Those Grunts are carrying explosives - look out!
Serina, we need to reestablish Alpha Base before we can proceed with the mission.
The base is up and running again. We need supply pads built so I can send down materials.
Well, well. Lookee here - the Covenant built themselves a little base.
Cargo ONE here. We can't take much more of this. Get them off us!
Cargo TWO. We're dead unless you get out here!
Pelican Bravo 29. Got a few stragglers for you! Requesting cover!
Angel here. Got some evac Marines here wanting to help. Cover my landing!
Keep the skies clear! Bravo 29 inbound with some troops.
This is Angel! My pelican could do with a little cover!
It's a bloodbath here! We need some cover, now!
That subway exit is being overrun!
A Sergeant in the UNSC, Forge wields a shotgun to decimate enemy units.
You're going to need Marines to take out that barrier's generator. Squad inbound.
Nice work! Let's get down there and see what the Covenant found so damn interesting.
Buffs the units in your squad
Attach this to a single squad to have the Protector generate a shield around the protected squad.
We're here to save as many civilians as we can, but there's no way we can save them all.
A maze of Forerunner structures creates a complex and challenging battlefield. The Forerunner Protector units may hold the key to victory.
The Dome power supply is overloaded, we got it!
Only one more Rhino to get into position.
MAC is coming online, single turret available.
MAC fully online, all rounds loaded. I'll take out the remaining structures.
Nice work! Let's get down there and see what the Covenant found so damn interesting.
We're on it Sergeant! Get moving with the professor!
Hope that data is worth it, Sarge - we're paying a price here!
Sergeant Forge, report to the bridge ASAP. We've got a new problem...
The MAC is charged and ready. This one is on the house.
Augmented with even more repurposed Forerunner technology, all Covenant shields now recharge much faster.
Upgrades the Prophet's plasma cannons to fuel rod cannons, increasing damage.
Two protectors hover near the Prophet and protect him.
Upgrades to the Prophet's chair grant him full flight capabilities.
The Cleansing Beam Ability is larger and does more damage.
The Cleansing Beam Ability is larger and does more damage.
The Cleansing Beam Ability burns even brighter, doing area damage.
The Fist of Rukt now stuns enemy units.
The Fist of Rukt gains the ability to charge up to allow Tartarus to pull his enemies to him.
The Fist of Rukt's area of effect is greatly increased, allowing multiple units to be stunned at once and increasing Tartarus' effectiveness against infantry.
Additional enemies may be drawn into the vortex and potential damage increased.
Additional enemies may be drawn into the vortex and potential damage increased.
Additional enemies may be drawn into the vortex and potential damage increased.
The Arbiter reflects some incoming damage back to his attacker.
The Arbiter reflects even more damage and has stronger attacks himself.
The Arbiter becomes permanently cloaked and increases reflected damage even more.
Health is restored every time the Arbiter inflicts a fatality in Rage Mode.
Rage Mode costs less to maintain.
Rage Mode increases Arbiter combo damage and the attack power of nearby allies.
Allows everyone on your team to see any enemy units and bases.
MAC Blast ammo capacity upgraded to provide two shots.
MAC Blast ammo capacity upgraded to provide three shots.
MAC Blast ammo capacity upgraded to provide four shots.
Carpet Bomb strafe distance and damage increased.
Carpet Bomb strafe distance and damage increased.
Carpet Bomb strafe distance and damage increased.
Better components dramatically improve laser attack damage and range for all Gremlins.
EMP Ability can chain to hit multiple targets.
These airlocks can be used to summon infantry from within Spirit of Fire to fight on its decks.
These larger airlocks can be used to requisition lager vehicles and flying units from Spirit of Fire.

Scattered pockets of Marines are isolated and under attack near Alpha Base. Locate as many as you can and kill the Covenant forces that are attacking them; the Marines will be needed to retake Alpha Base.
The Covenant have erected an energy barrier across the pass leading to Alpha Base. The barrier will block vehicles, but Marines can move through and destroy the power source beyond.
Alpha Base is the key UNSC installation on Harvest. Covenant forces have completely overrun the facility. Defeating the Covenant units in the area is a top priority.

Grunts, called Unggoy in the Covenant language, are cowardly but dangerous in large numbers. Methane breathers, they are commonly seen in Covenant infantry squads. Counter them with your own infantry, or with Flamethrowers.
The Covenant attack has heavily damaged Alpha Base. Get it back up and running by building Supply Pads and military buildings.
A Supply Pad is a key component of any military base. Stockpiling supplies will let us build additional structures and train military forces.
A Barracks at Alpha Base will allow military units to be trained there.
With enough boots on the ground, Alpha Base will be safe once more. After the Marines are trained, patrols can be sent out and the surrounding area secured.
The structure is north of Alpha Base, past the Covenant forces. You will have to fight your way through enemy forces to get there.
The Covenant were after the secrets buried in the Forerunner structure. Enter and learn what you can.
The Covenant are planning to destroy the Forerunner structure. Take out the detonator.
Jackals are birdlike aliens who serve as Covenant scouts and sharpshooters. Lacking durability, they often carry energy shields. Counter them with armed Warthogs or Flamethrowers.
The Covenant are refining methane on Harvest to supply their Grunt squads. Taking out the refinery would slow them down.
Several UNSC units are trapped. Rescue them to bolster your forces.
Anders will need time to activate the hardlight bridge. Keep the Covenant forces at bay until she succeeds.
Get Forge and Anders to the exit. The Covenant will overwhelm you if you wait too long.
Anders may still be able to activate the second bridge and give the UNSC forces a chance to escape.
It is vital that Anders returns to Spirit of Fire with the information from the Forerunner structure. Get her and Forge to the landing zone ASAP.
Forge and his troops can only hold off the Covenant for so long. They will need support, rescue, and extraction.
Deactivating the bridge will drop any units trying to cross it into the chasm below. Use this information to your advantage.

Hunters are collective colonies of small creatures packed into assault armor. They are very heavily armored, but have a weakness. Attack them from behind with Anti-Infantry units to take them down much more easily.
Eliminate the Covenant forces around the subway exit so the civilians have a clear path to the transports.
The civilians will head toward the transports on their own. At least one of the transport ships must survive; the citys population has no other way to evacuate the area.

A base in the city will let you train more units to protect the civilians and transports. If you can assemble enough of a force, it might even be possible to launch a limited counterattack against the Covenant.
Elites, also known as Sangheili, are often seen leading Covenant forces into battle. Using their cloaks and energy swords to surprise and overwhelm their enemies, Elites are challenging opponents.
Covenant forces are swarming all over the crater. Take out all the enemies and create a safe zone.
Additional UNSC forces are on approach to your location. The crater is excellent defensive terrain; hold fast, maintain a base in the crater, and wait for help.
Covenant forces are closing in. Get to the southern crater and try to hold out.
If the Covenant base is destroyed, the UNSC position on Arcadia will be secure. All of the base buildings and any nearby Covenant units must be eliminated.
More production capacity would give you a fighting chance to defeat the Covenant. If the crater is secure, try to claim an additional base.
The Wraith is a heavy vehicle equipped with a plasma mortar. Used at the forefront of ground assaults, they are a critical component of the Covenant arsenal. Counter them with Cobras.
The Covenant are attacking in force. Fight off the assault.
You will need to get several Rhinos in position to be able to bring enough firepower to bear on the dome. Rhinos will be dropped at the landing pad.

Positions for the Rhinos are marked. Protect each Rhino until it can safely deploy at the marked destination. The Spirit of Fire menu has an option that allows you to use Pelicans to transport Rhinos.
The Rhinos are all in position. Wipe out the enemy structures and bring down the dome.
A fast-moving flying unit, the Banshee is highly maneuverable. Equipped with plasma cannon, it provides deadly and effective air support for Covenant forces. Counter Banshees with Wolverines.
Taking control of the nearby ONI Reactors will let you train advanced troops more quickly.
The Scarab must be destroyed before it wipes out your base. Keep your forces out of the head's line of fire.
The nodes are secondary power sources for the Scarab. If they are destroyed, the Scarab will not be able to turn its head as quickly.
The spider-like Locust is slow-moving but powerful. It is designed to destroy structures, and is less effective against units. Counter the Locust with Marines or Scorpions.
Spirit's forces must secure the marked location for a base. This planet's atmosphere is highly unusual; use caution and stay alert for signs of trouble.
The Elephant is a fully equipped mobile training center. Once deployed, it can mobilize infantry and serve as a forward base.
The Elephants are extremely valuable military hardware and must be retrieved at all costs. Send your forces out to recover them.

The first stage of a mysterious alien life form, it is highly aggressive and dangerous. The infection forms attempt to penetrate the spinal cords of their victims. They can be countered by massed fire from virtually any military unit.
The Spartans have gone ahead, following Anders' signal. Link up with them and reinforce their position before it's too late.
Anders' signal is up ahead. Send patrols forward to locate and rescue her.
Data analysis suggests that killing the pods should weaken the larger infection form. Taking out as many pods as possible is the safest tactical approach.
Once enough of the pods are destroyed, the primary infection should be engaged. Use caution - even after it has been weakened, it is still an extremely dangerous opponent.
These alien lifeforms are possibly providing nutrients to the smaller infection variants. They are easily destroyed by any unit.
Alpha, Bravo, and Charlie platoons have been cut off beyond the areas overrun by the Flood. Your soldiers will have to clear a path through the Flood and bring them back to the LZ.
Escort the platoon back through the Flood-infested areas. Watch out for any infection forms and keep them away from your infantry.
A Gremlin may be able to temporarily disrupt the pylons and delay the automatic docking procedure. In theory, this should buy Spirit of Fire more time.
UNSC weapons can damage, but not completely destroy, the alien structures. Only the tunnel's technology can permanently clear the forms off Spirits hull.

The Flood must not be allowed to breach the airlocks. If the airlocks are destroyed, we will not be able to send reinforcements and the Flood may move in between the outer and inner hulls of the Spirit of Fire.
Flood structures have attached themselves to the outside of Spirit of Fire's hull, and are threatening to break through the airlocks. Destroy them all before they infect the ship.
The airlocks provide some cover for our infantry. Order them inside.
Controlled by some sort of A.I., these small high-tech constructions appear to be designed to contain the infection forms. Counter them with any military unit.
We're almost out - the exit is in sight.
That thing is blocking our escape. Take it down, and bring us up to flank speed. We'll leave these drones behind us.
Serina, maximum power to the engines. Get us out of here!
The ring is helping clear the infestation from the hull. We just have to hold those aliens off until it can clean the ship.
Bad news. I intercepted a signal from the alien A.I. Those drones have declared us a threat and are massing behind us.
What the...get in the airlocks or we're all dead!
Take cover - another cleansing wave is coming.
All clear - the hull is clean.
A Covenant base is between our forces and our primary objective. Destroying it will secure the path to the Forerunner structure.
Keep constructing buildings and upgrading them where you can.
We noticed a few colony creatures on the way in. We can weaken the big one by taking them out first. Uploading coordinates.
I've lost Anders' transponder - could the creature be jamming the signal?
The energy field is reacting to the aliens - it's trying to clean our hull. Take cover out there!
Toggles the A.I. Advisor for Skirmish games. The A.I. Advisor will offer helpful suggestions and hints during Skirmish games.
Set the difficulty of A.I. opponents for new Skirmish games. Automatic will adjust the quality of the A.I. opponents, between games, to match your evolving skills.
Allows camera rotation with the right stick.
Set how close the camera is to the terrain by default.
Set how sticky the crosshair is when moved around the battlefield. Stickier cameras will pop to nearby units.
Adjust the speed at which the left stick scrolls the camera across the map.
The camera will follow the unit under the crosshair. Move the left stick to stop the camera from following the targeted unit.
Adjust the volume for sound effects.
Adjust the volume for voiced dialogue.
Turns on subtitles for all cinematic dialogue.
Adjust the overall brightness of the game's visuals.
Use Friend or Foe (team) colors instead of individual player colors.
Enable a closer view on the minimap, allowing you to see more detail at the expense of scope.
This densely built-up urban region of Arcadia features several sniper towers protecting key areas.
Impassable terrain creates a nested trio of rings that defines this large battlefield. More base sites are found on the outermost ring, but controlling the center is tactically superior.
Thank God you found us - we thought we were goners for sure.
Are we glad to see you. We weren't sure if you were one of them or not.
There were more of us in our platoon. We all scattered when it hit the fan.
Stay away from me - you're one of them! Bllaahhhh!
The swampy outskirts of Arcadia's capital city features unclaimed bonus Reactors and offers alternate routes for attacks.
A fast and brutal fight awaits in Blood Gulch. Teleporters allow for surprise attacks, while bonus Reactors offer opportunities for the aggressive.
Sections of the map are only accessible by timed light bridges. Watch for the bridges to start blinking - any units on the bridges when the bridges turn off are doomed.
Named for a famous UNSC colonel who broke a Covenant siege, this divided map features highly defendable lanes, but strategically-placed teleporters offer clever attackers alternatives.
About time you guys showed up!
Captain, as soon as that creature died, I picked up a new signal just east of here.
Optional: Have all 5 Flood Colonies dormant at once

Forcing all five colonies into a dormant state at the same time will make the hive mind much easier to destroy. Stay alert; the dormant colonies cannot be completely destroyed by UNSC weaponry, and they will regenerate over time.
Those flying engineer things want to repair the Scarab! Destroy them!
Transfer command of nearby selected units to the other co-op player.
The drones and the cleansing ring seem to be able to remove the aliens if they are already damaged.
Two Vultures have just finished repairs, they're yours to command.
Keep killing those things! The big one is even weaker!
Rhino under attack here - could use some reinforcements!
Rhino here - send support to my location!
Rhino being overrun; need immediate support!
Task Units on Teleporter to Use
Regenerating? Why can't these things just stay dead once I kill them?
Press UP on $$DPAD$$ to enter Spirit of Fire Powers
Press $$A$$ over the units in the area you want to transport, then press $$A$$ at the destination you want to transport to.
This didn't go as I planned. Fall back to Spirit of Fire.
Increases the duration of the freeze effect and instantly kills more air units.
Increases the duration of the freeze effect and instantly kills more air units.
Increases the duration of the freeze effect and instantly kills more air units.
Forge to Cutter. I'm beginning my ascent. Estimate 30 minutes to the detonation site.
Forge here. Im at the access point to the sun. Will need some time to break through.
Im in the sun. You heard Serina. Ill wait ten minutes, then detonate the core. Thats all the time I can give you.
Copy that. Get our people out of here - Im blowing the core!
Times up. I've gotta blow the core. We cant let the Covenant get those ships.
Captain, the exit passage has been sealed. Our escape is blocked.
Covenant forces will be at Forge's position in approximately 10 minutes.
We've spotted a large Covenant base west of the portal.
Watch out - several large Covenant vehicles have been spotted.
Ground teams! Find a way to open that portal or we're all dead.
Roger that. We cant let them leave with those ships. Good luck, Sergeant.
Sergeant Forge, all ground forces are evacuating to the Spirit of Fire.
Get those troops back on board! Now!
The portal has six doors. You'll need to open them in the correct order.
The doors have some sort of alien glyphs on them...that may be the key to opening them.
That's it! The doors are paired! You need to activate both doors of a set to open them!
We are detecting movement coming from the east side of the portal. Possible large alien infection.
Air support en route, Sergeant. They'll take out the armor, the rest is yours.
That thing is too strong - use grenades!
Marines can gather additional Supplies from Crates in the area.
Captain, the base power system is offline and the lockdown protocol is in effect. If we rebuild, the lockdown will end and the doors will open.
Projection for new base location ready.
The minimap is a view of the entire map.
The small circle is where you are looking.
Destroying the Shield World is the only way to deny the Covenant its secrets. The FTL core must be towed to the Apex.
The FTL core is heavy, but an Elephant should be able to drag it to the Apex.
Vampires are very effective at destroying UNSC aircraft. Counter them with Wolverines.
We're going to need a larger army.
Task Marines on Crates for extra Supplies.
The ONI Reactors on the map should be claimed. They offer a way to improve Spirit of Fire's forces without building Reactors at our base.
Establishing a second base would provide additional supplies for our troops and help hold back the Covenant forces.
One of the transports is heavily damaged. Spirit of Fire's Leader Power menu includes an option to repair it.
Point $$LS$$ to move. Point $$RS$$ to attack.
Several squads of ODSTs are missing. Locate and rescue them.
Contact with Echo Team has been lost. It is vital to learn what became of them and their Elephant.
The vehicles were taken by the strange life forms. The Elephants are an expensive and important weapon in Spirit of Fire's arsenal; they must be found and recovered.
Sergeant Forge, we need those deck guns.
Use this to construct a new Keep. Eventually, it can be upgraded to a full Citadel, increasing your ability to crush the evil enemy filth.
Use this to construct a new Citadel.
Sergeant Forge rallied several squads of marines and drove the Covenant forces out of Alpha Base.
Having rebuilt Alpha Base and fought their way through to the relic, Sergeant Forge and his men arrived just in time to stop Covenant forces from destroying it.
With the help of the Grizzly tanks, Forge and Anders fought their way past Covenant forces and out of the relic.
Though there were many casualties, several large transports carrying refugees managed to escape from Arcadia thanks to Spirit of Fire's forces.
After retreating from the city to a large crater, Forge and his men rallied and counterattacked, destroying a Covenant base.
Strategic placement of Spirit of Fire's Rhinos helped bring down the Covenant energy dome. A Covenant super weapon is now vulnerable to attack.
The Covenant's efforts to complete the construction of a Super Scarab ended in failure. UNSC forces got the job done, eliminating a major threat.
Several lost Elephants and ODST squads were recovered, and Spirit's ground forces engaged a mysterious alien life form.
Anders' transponder signal was a fake generated by the alien hive mind. After a difficult fight, UNSC forces successfully destroyed the creature.
With time running out, most of Spirit's ground forces successfully returned to the ship before it was drawn inside the strange world.
As alien life forms swarmed all over Spirit of Fire's hull, the Marines made a desperate but ultimately successful stand at the hatches and airlocks.
After the collision with the Covenant destroyer, Spirit's crew managed to repair the ship and disengage.
Professor Anders was finally rescued and made it to the landing zone for extraction.
Using Elephants to drag the reactor core to the top of the Apex, Spirit's crew got the core in position to detonate and hopefully destroy the Shield World.
Though many good soldiers fell in battle, Spirit of Fire's crew opened the Forerunner structure's doors and escaped from the interior of the Shield World.
The lockdown is lifted and the front gate is opening.
We can't let them take out any more airlocks!
Quickly transport your Leader back to this position.
The Covenant have overrun all UNSC positions. We need to regroup and try this again.
The Mega Turret is down - good work!
Sergeant Forge, rendezvous with RED Team and find Anders, but be careful - we don't know what these things are capable of.
Captain Cutter reflects on the events that bring Spirit of Fire to Harvest. Sergeant Forge reports that the Covenant are still on the planet surface.
Sergeant Forge makes a startling discovery while Professor Anders prepares to go down to the surface of the planet.Meanwhile, the Arbiter is ordered to destroy the Forerunner installation.
Professor Anders and Sergeant Forge activate the Forerunner installation.
The information from Harvest points the crew of Spirit of Fire towards Arcadia, another UNSC colony world.When Spirit of Fire arrives, the world is already under attack by the Covenant.
The Arbiter is ordered to capture Professor Anders.
The Covenant have built a shield on the surface of Arcadia and the crew debate how to find out what they are hiding.
Professor Anders is kidnapped by the Covenant. Spirit of Fire pursues her kidnappers deep into enemy space.
Serina accidently unlocks the secret of the Shield World and opens the entrance portal, dragging Spirit of Fire inside the planet.
The entrance to the Shield World closes behind Spirit of Fire while the ship descends deep into the planet.
Spirit of Fire enters the interior of the Shield World and collides with a Covenant destroyer.
Professor Anders is forced to unlock the Forerunner dreadnaught ships and escapes to the surface.
The crew decides to detonate their FTL reactor in order to stop the Covenant from using the Forerunner dreadnaughts.
In a final confrontation between the Arbiter and Sergeant Forge, the reactor is damaged and one of the crew must make the ultimate sacrifice.
Spirit of Fire narrowly escapes from the exploding Shield World.
Professor Anders enters cryo sleep under protest.

In Halo Wars, you (the player) are in control of single units, as well as large armies. You can give those units simple orders to move, attack, or use their special abilities. Ultimately, your goal is to use your units and armies to complete objectives and win scenarios.

Bases in Halo Wars are very important to your success. You choose which buildings you want to build and upgrade at your base. Buildings at your base can be used to train and upgrade units, creating powerful armies to fight the enemy. But dont forget - the enemy is doing the same thing and its all happening in real time.

The ship Spirit of Fire is always in orbit above the planet. The ships special powers can be called upon to get out of sticky situations. As you progress through the campaign, check this menu to see which powers are available to you. Some of the powers at your fingertips will include Heal and Repair, Carpet Bombing, and a giant MAC Cannon blast.

The areas of the map that are black or foggy are places you either have not been or do not have line of sight. You can select and move your units into these areas to obtain line of sight. Remember, the black map goes away if you have been there but the fog of war remains unless one of your units has line of sight to the area.
Spirit of Fire was heavily damaged in the collision. The power center must be repaired and brought back online before the ship can disengage.
A Spirit is the Covenant dropship, used for transporting infantry and support troops. Spirits carry groups of Covenant units to battle.
The deck guns are helping to hold back the Covenant assault. Keep as many as possible intact.
Professor Anders must be rescued. Push forward and secure the landing zone.
The initial LZ is not secure. A safer, alternative LZ might be found beyond the teleporter.
Hold the landing zone at all costs. If your forces are overrun, all hope is lost.
The Scarab is a powerful Covenant super weapon. If captured, it would provide much-needed support for our forces. Only Spartans are capable of capturing the Scarab.
The alien bomber forms are a threat to our ground forces. Counter them with Wolverines.
If Spirit of Fire is going to escape from the Forerunner structure, the door must be opened. The unlocking mechanism appears to be some sort of giant puzzle.
A heavily armored walker designed to smash through enemy armies, the Scarab is a nearly unstoppable killing machine. If one appears on the battlefield, the best counters are Scorpions and Cobras.
We need to know what's under that dome. Prepare for redeployment.
When Grunts die, their methane tank always shoots off.
Scarabs shoot rainbow beams made of Pure Love.
No minimap. Final score will increase.
All player units have 50% fewer hitpoints. Final score will increase.
Non-player units get 25% more hitpoints. Final score will increase.
Non-player units do 50% more damage. Final score will increase.
Non-player units start with extra veterancy. Final score will increase.
All player units recharge unit abilities in half the time. Final score will decrease.
All player units have 50% more hitpoints. Final score will decrease.
5% chance any unit blows up upon death with explosive area of effect damage. Final score will decrease.
All player units train 50% faster. Final score will decrease.
Supplies come in 25% faster. Final score will decrease.
All player powers recharge in half the time. Final score will decrease.
This new threat is more deadly and smarter than I initially thought.
Im sure that didnt go quite as planned. Go back to the base and train an army thats more formidable.
Releasing the Interlock Nodes in a specific order will open the portal. There seems to be a hidden meaning to the alien glyphs embedded in the hard-light doors.
Releasing the Interlock Nodes in a specific order will open the portal. The Nodes are only accessible when humans and no other life forms are near them.
A planetary network of high-speed rails, the Arcadian tram system was heavily damaged in the initial Covenant assault. Intact tram stations are serving as temporary shelters for evacuating refugees.
Based on Anders' observations, the alien technology will only react to human touch.
Any other alien life nearby will lock the system.
Clear out the area around this interlock!
More Spartans! Serina you never disappoint.
Roger that Captain, most of us are heading out of the city through the traffic tunnels.
Who am I in Halo Wars?

In Halo Wars, you (the player) are in control of single units, as well as large armies. You can give those units simple orders to move, attack, or use their special abilities. Ultimately, your goal is to use your units and armies to complete objectives and win scenarios.

Bases in Halo Wars are very important to your success. You choose which buildings you want to build and upgrade at your base. Buildings at your base can be used to train and upgrade units, creating powerful armies to fight the enemy. But dont forget - the enemy is doing the same thing and its all happening in real time.

The ship Spirit of Fire is always in orbit above the planet. The ships special powers can be called upon to get out of sticky situations. As you progress through the campaign, check this menu to see which powers are available to you. Some of the powers at your fingertips will include Heal and Repair, Carpet Bombing, and a giant MAC Cannon blast.
Black Map and Fog of War
Some areas of the map are black or foggy. The black map goes away once your units have explored the area, but the fog of war remains unless you have line of sight to the area with one of your units.

Our power core is about seventy-five percent repaired.
Our power core has been damaged further and is now only about twenty percent repaired!
Captain, if our air units fly through the ring in the opposite direction, it will minimize damage.
Clear Out all Enemies Near the Interlock Tower
Hey, thanks for that, Sergeant. Need a Cobra?
The MAC is barely scratching that thing.
We should use the MAC to defend our base, or, destroy power nodes.
We can't deactivate that bridge while friendlies are on it!

The hard-working people who brought you Halo Wars.
Fight your way to Alpha Base
Alpha Base is in the northern section of the map. It has been overrun by the Covenant; get there and take it back.
Only the active gamer profile is allowed to join Xbox Live games.
The Halo Wars servers are currently unavailable. The game will use a default set of matchmaking types until the servers become available.
The enemy units near the interlock towers appear to be preventing them from working. They appear to function if humans are nearby, but other life forms must be cleared from the area.
The nodes appear to be laid out in some sort of pattern. If they can be activated in the correct sequence, the portal door sections may open.
Welcome to the Halo Wars tutorial. It will teach you the basic commands and controls used to play Halo Wars.
Let's start with controlling the camera so you can find your way around the map.
You will simply move the $$LS$$ in the direction you want the camera to go.
See if you can move the camera to the three flares that the blue objective arrow points to.
Great! Now lets learn how to select your units.
You will use what you learned about controlling the camera to center the crosshair in the middle of the screen over what you want to select.
Perfect! Now you have a unit selected and you can see the unit type at the bottom of the screen.
Lets issue a move order to the next smoke flare you see.
Just move the crosshair to where you want the unit to go and press $$X$$.
Notice that as your units move to new places on the map, the dark or fogged-over areas get revealed.
Good! Just keep following the blue objective arrow.
You now have more units to control. Select them all.
You can do this by pressing the $$LB$$.
Good! Now, using what you learned to move one unit, lets move all of these units.
Move the crosshair to where you want to go, then press $$X$$.
Keep following the blue objective arrow to the last target.
We need to get through that Covenant shield. Lets order our army to attack the power source.
Just like you did when you moved your units, select your units and move the crosshair over what you want to attack. Then press $$X$$.
The shield is down! Follow the blue objective arrow and practice attacking some other targets.
Remember, however, that some enemy targets in Halo Wars can fight back.
These last targets seem much stronger.
Luckily, some units in Halo Wars have special abilities.
Try attacking this target using the $$Y$$ button instead of the $$X$$ button.
This ends the basic controls tutorial for Halo Wars. For more advanced controls, try playing the advanced tutorial.
Please sign-in with an Xbox Live gamer profile.
Are you sure you want to load? Any unsaved progress will be lost.
You have lost your connection to Xbox Live. Unable to continue matchmaking.
You have lost your connection to Xbox Live. Unable to maintain your online session.
You have lost your network connection.
Are you sure you want to quit? Your current progress will be saved.
There was a problem servicing your request through Xbox Live. Please check your network connection and try again.
About time! I won't forget this!
Welcome to the Halo Wars advanced tutorial. We will cover more advanced concepts that you can use to play Halo Wars.
Select the Warthog, then follow the blue objective arrow to the first target.
Good! Lets start with the Warthog's Ram ability.
Nice! Keep following the objective arrow and ram another target.
In Halo Wars you are going to need supplies to buy and upgrade things.
There are a few ways to get supplies. The first one we are going to learn is gathering supplies from crates.
Follow the objective arrow to the next location.
Gathering from crates increases your supplies.
The amount of supplies you have is shown in the top right corner, next to the small crate icon.
Okay - lets gather these crates. Just move the crosshair over them and press $$X$$.
Good! Now that we have some supplies we can start building some things at our base.
Move the camera back to the UNSC base.
Using $$LS$$, push and hold to highlight the Supply Pad, then press $$A$$ to begin building it.
A Supply Pad is another way to get supplies.
Go ahead and build a second Supply Pad so your supplies are coming in at a steady pace.
Now your supplies should be coming in at a good rate.
With all these supplies we are ready to start building an army, but we will need a Barracks first.
Select a building site and build a Barracks.
Good! Now we can start training an army.
Select the Barracks and train five Marine Squads.
You can queue up more than one Marine squad at a time by selecting them in the circle menu and pressing $$A$$ five times.
Excellent! If you pan the camera to the front of your base you will see your army.
Now lets upgrade your army to make them more powerful.
To do this we will need to select a building site and build a Reactor.
Notice that you now have a number one by the small lightning bolt icon in the top right corner above your supply number.
This is how many Reactors you have.
Remember, as you increase your Reactor count, more units become available for you to train and upgrade.
Having one Reactor will allow you to upgrade those Marines.
Select the barracks and upgrade your Marines with the New Blood technology.
Good! Now your Marines are upgraded.
Lets follow the objective arrow and learn about Leader Powers.
The Covenant has been kind enough to stand here while we practice using some of the Leader Powers.
Lets start with a UNSC MAC blast.
Press up on $$DPAD$$ to see the Leader Power menu.
Now select the MAC Blast and lets blow up some stuff.
We'll keep giving you additional MAC Blast shots, so just have fun until all the Wraiths are destroyed.
Great! Now that you've learned to command the UNSC, we're going to jump over and show you how to lead the Covenant.
The Covenant Leader Powers are different than the UNSC Leader Powers because they are treated like the Leader's $$Y$$ ability.
The Prophet of Regret is trapped.
Using his Cleansing Leader Power you will be able to free him.
Select the Prophet and use his $$Y$$ ability to destroy the three power sources.
Once you press $$Y$$ the power will begin and stay on screen. Then, using $$LS$$, steer the Cleansing beam around to the three Power Sources to destroy them.
To learn some more advanced features of Covenant upgrading we are going to jump to a Covenant base.
Just press left on $$DPAD$$ to do this now.
The Covenant base may look very different from the UNSC base but it works in a similar way.
Select the building site and build a Factory.
There are some powerful units that can be trained in the Factory but we need to upgrade the tech level before we can train some of them.
Unlike the UNSC building Reactors to upgrade Tech Level, the Covenant upgrade Tech Level by researching Ages.
Select the Temple and upgrade to the Age of Doubt.
The Covenant can also research strong defenses.
Select a building site and build a Shield Generator.
As you can see, a shield has appeared around this base. Now it's time for an army!
Select the Factory and train four Locusts.
As your new Locusts train, send them into the Hot Drop Pad.
They will instantly teleport to wherever your Covenant Leader is on the map.
To quickly jump to your leader you can press up on $$DPAD$$.
Now select your Covenant army and go destroy the UNSC army nearby.
Congratulations! You have successfully completed the Halo Wars advanced tutorial! You are ready to take on the universe!
Move near hero at half health to recover.

Language.String: Waiting for others to join to start the game.
You are not signed in. In order to save progress, you will need to be signed in. Do you want to sign in now?
Do you want to play the Tutorial?
Selected game search is no longer valid. Please select another.
There are several ways to select units. If your crosshair is over a unit, press $$A$$ to select it.
To move a unit, select it, move the crosshair to where you want it to go, and press $$X$$.
To select all the units, press $$LB$$. You can also "paint" a selection by holding down $$A$$ and moving $$LS$$.
To move multiple units, select them, move the crosshair to where you want them to go, and press $$X$$.
To move the camera around the battlefield, simply move $$LS$$.
To attack, select units, move the crosshair over the enemy you wish to attack with $$LS$$, then press $$X$$.
To improve your technology, you will need Reactors to improve your technology level. Upgrades are always on the left side of a building's circle menu.
To train units, select a building, use $$LS$$ to select the unit you wish to train, then press $$A$$ to train a unit. Press $$A$$ multiple times to queue up additional units.

Press UP on $$DPAD$$ to see the Leader Power menu. Select the power using the $$LS$$, then press $$A$$ to select the power. You will then need to target the power where you want to use it - in this case, on enemy Wraiths and other units.
To order units to gather supplies from supply crates, select the units, move the crosshair over the crates, and press $$X$$.
The Covenant need to research Ages at their Temple in order to increase their technology level.
The Hot Drop Pad allows Covenant units to teleport to your Leader. Select Covenant units and send them into the Hot Drop Pad.
Cleansing is the Prophet's unique ability. Select the Prophet and press $$Y$$ to start cleansing. Steer the cleansing beam with $$LS$$.
To construct a building, select an empty building site at the base and press $$A$$. Then select the building you wish to construct with $$LS$$ and press $$A$$ again to start construction.
To use a unit's special ability instead of its normal attack, select the unit, target an enemy, and press $$Y$$.
Use special abilities, standard attacks, and leader powers to destroy all enemy units. For the Covenant!
ONI Reactors provide the energy needed to access advanced buildings, units and technology upgrades. High-tech bases may have as many as four or five Reactors.

Language.String: Our own men are infected! Quick, take them out before they turn on us!
Our own men are turning on us! Shoot them!

Destroys Player Flood Bases in order to make teams unbalanced.

Learn about the basics of playing Halo Wars
Learn more advanced features about playing Halo Wars
Halo Wars is a game about controlling armies composed of different types of units.
Remember, if you're confused about how to issue commands to your units, you can view the controls from the PAUSE menu.
Any time you train units in Halo Wars, they will continue to train even if you close the circle menu and turn your attention elsewhere.
Cut power to the bridge. Safety overrides will prevent power from being shut down if friendly units are on the bridge.
Press up on $$DPAD$$ to use Leader Powers.
Press left on $$DPAD$$ to jump to base.
Press up on $$DPAD$$ to jump to Leader.
